result.execSummary:
Jeffery Joseph Riley was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Jeffery Joseph Riley was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Walter H Isaacson in court.  Mary E Bricco appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Deft is extradited.

Defendant Jeffery Joseph Riley in court in custody with attorney Walter H Isaacson.  Mason C Braunschweig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Deft waives right to extradition.  Further proceedings scheduled for July 1, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Defendant Jeffery Joseph Riley in court in custody with attorney Cheniqua L White.  Gwanny J Tjoa appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed, continued.
